Posts.Content: Oct 4, 2008 01:44AM Lesley-Ann wrote: I also had lumpectomy /sentinal node removal almost 3 weeks ago.  I can't eat - no appetite and food smells bad. I am very emotional and seem to cry very easily (used to be able to swallow the tears but don't seem to be able to do that anymore).  Have not received any support on these issues from DH who is like "what? are you in a mood again." or "well don't eat then" and gets angry and yells. I am quite frankly sick and tired of this and wish that I didn't have the surgery and just waited for my time to be up after a year.  Was due to start rads and hormone treatment on the 3rd Oct but "postponed" until surgeon back from vacation.  See him on the 08th Oct but am so down and sad that I don't want to continue treatment and just want to say to hell with it.  DH not interested in this 'condition' at all.  Does not read up about it or educate himself re what is happening.  Just gets angry because I'm not 'the same as I used to be' which upsets me very much.  Says he is not coming into appointment with me because 'he doesn't like him'.  Well he doesn't have to like my surgeon to show an interest does he? I like my surgeon and that should be enough???  Is there any else out there who feels like this or am I alone in feeling like this?????
Posts.Title: Anyone out there taking anti-anxiety meds? Wink PugMum
